definitions.definition: A series of threads or other projections resembling a fringe .

subdefinitions.definition: An individual thread in a fimbria, especially a fingerlike projection around the ovarian end of the Fallopian tube .
examples: When a follicle is mature, the egg within it bursts out of the ovary, and the Fallopian tube's fingerlike fimbria reach out and grab it.

subdefinitions.definition: A hairlike appendage found on the cell surface of many bacteria ; used by the bacteria to adhere to one another, to animal cells and to some inanimate objects.

main_definition: ( biology ) A series of threads or other projections resembling a fringe .
